newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU cereals farmers over-subsidised, Fischler says.
newsitem.headline: EU cereals farmers over-subsidised, Fischler says.

text.p: European Union cereals farmers have been over-compensated for cuts in support prices, EU Farm Commissioner Franz Fischler said on Wednesday.
"There has been over-payment and this is my main argument that the Commission's proposal (to cut aid) should be left on the negotiating table," Fischler told a news conference.
Most EU farm ministers have strongly attacked Fischler's proposal to cut aid payments to cereals farmers by 1.4 billion ecus to help provide aid for beef producers hit by the mad cow crisis.
Fischler was responding to a question about a British agriculture ministry report calculating that the EU will have overpaid cereals farmers by 17 billion ecus over four years to June 1997.
The payments were agreed under a 1992 reform of the Common Agricultural Policy to compensate farmers for expected revenue losses due to cuts in intervention prices and set-aside production curbs.
But cereals market prices have risen well above intervention levels and the EU last year produced a record grain crop after the set-aside rate was lowered and favourable weather.
Fischler said he could not confirm the British figure.
Over-payments varied from country to country, he noted, adding that they were highest in Britain.
